item.title: 金-卡戴珊和曲奇饼干在美国掀起 TikTok 实时购物热潮
item.description: 本月早些时候，金-卡戴珊（Kim Kardashian）登录 TikTok 做了一件新鲜事：试图像老式电视信息广告的主持人一样推销睡衣、拖鞋和配套运动套装。【原文：Kim Kardashian logged onto TikTok earlier this month and did something new: Tried to sell pajamas, slippers and matching sweat sets like the host of an old-fashioned TV infomercial.】

item.title: 中国便携式电源公司 EcoFlow 据称计划在美国上市
item.description: 据熟悉这家便携式电池制造商计划的人士透露，EcoFlow Technology Inc.【原文：EcoFlow Technology Inc. is considering an initial public offering in the US, according to people familiar with the portable battery maker’s plans, marking a rare move for a Chinese company of that size.】

item.title: 德意志银行称亚马逊交易标志着 RWE 数据中心的发薪日
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）周二在一份报告中称，RWE AG 已将其在英国的前煤炭工厂 Didcot A 出售给亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc.【原文：RWE AG has sold its former UK coal plant Didcot A to Amazon.com Inc., and could reap a major windfall from similar deals ahead, Deutsche Bank AG said Tuesday in a note.】

item.title: 博鳌亚洲论坛分析师认为瑞银每股收益增长在银行中名列前茅，瑞银因此获得 "牛股 "称号
item.description: 据美国银行（Bank of America Corp）分析师称，瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）的每股收益将以全球所有银行中最快的速度连续增长。【原文：UBS Group AG is set to grow earnings per share at the fastest sequential pace of any bank globally, according to analysts at Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 英国企业采购经理人指数（PMI）显示预算案后新订单激增
item.description: 一项调查显示，英国企业的新工作量出现了一年多来最大幅度的回升，这表明企业受到了预算案中数月来有关增税猜测的终结的鼓舞。【原文：British businesses enjoyed the sharpest pick-up in new work in more than a year, according to a survey that suggests firms were buoyed by an end to months of speculation around tax hikes in the budget.】

item.title: 韦丹塔获法院批准分拆业务，股价创历史新高
item.description: 亿万富翁阿尼尔-阿加瓦尔（Anil Agarwal）的韦丹塔有限公司（Vedanta Ltd.）已获得印度一家法院的批准，可以拆分这家庞大的企业集团，从而推动母公司减轻数十亿美元债务负担的努力。【原文：Billionaire Anil Agarwal’s Vedanta Ltd. has secured approval from an Indian court to break up the sprawling conglomerate, advancing efforts to reduce its multi-billion debt burden at the parent level.】

item.title: 什么是熊市？美银美林民调显示投资者对 2026 年普遍持乐观态度
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的月度民意调查显示，从经济增长到股票和大宗商品，资金经理们都将带着坚定的信心迎接新的一年。【原文：Money managers are set to ring in the new year with resounding confidence about everything from economic growth to equities and commodities, according to a monthly poll by Bank of America Corp.】

item.title: 亚马逊卢森堡欧洲枢纽为创纪录的裁员做准备
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）今年早些时候决定裁减全球 1.4 万名员工，这一决定在该公司位于卢森堡的欧洲总部引起了反响。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s decision earlier this year to ax 14,000 employees around the globe is reverberating at the company’s European headquarters in Luxembourg.】

item.title: 英国央行会议记录显示理事会对外汇波动和住房风险保持警惕
item.description: 会议纪要显示，韩国央行政策委员会的大多数成员都将货币波动加剧和房地产市场风险挥之不去作为维持上月利率不变的理由。【原文：Most members of the Bank of Korea’s policy board flagged elevated currency volatility and lingering housing-market risks as reasons to keep interest rates unchanged last month, minutes from their meeting showed.】

item.title: 欧元区经济活动低于预期，德国工业受到影响
item.description: 由于德国工业部门意外恶化，12 月份欧元区私营部门活动的增长低于预期。【原文：Private-sector activity in the euro area grew less than anticipated in December as Germany’s industrial sector unexpectedly deteriorated.】

item.title: 经合组织称人工智能投资将持续增长并促进世界经济发展
item.description: 经合组织（OECD）秘书长马蒂亚斯-科尔曼（Mathias Cormann）表示，人工智能投资的激增推动了世界经济增长，并将继续带来长期收益。【原文：The surge in artificial intelligence investment that has buoyed world growth is set to continue and deliver longer-term gains, OECD Secretary General Mathias Cormann said.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）要求比利时就债务负担采取行动，否则将面临市场反弹风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）表示，比利时必须采取行动解决公共财政问题，否则一旦金融市场迫使政府出手，比利时将面临需要采取更严厉措施的风险。【原文：Belgium must act to fix its public finances or risk the need for more drastic efforts if financial markets force the government’s hand, according to the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 德国商业活动因工业疲软而不及预期
item.description: 由于制造业意外创下 10 个月来的最差表现，12 月份德国私营部门活动的增长速度低于预期。【原文：German private-sector activity grew at a weaker pace than anticipated in December as manufacturing unexpectedly recorded its worst performance in 10 months.】

item.title: 中国最终裁定放宽欧盟猪肉进口关税
item.description: 中国对欧盟猪肉征收的最终进口关税水平大大低于 9 月份最初宣布的水平。【原文：China set final import tariffs on European Union pork at significantly lower levels than initially announced in September.】

item.title: 服务业疲软导致法国私营部门增长低于预期
item.description: 法国商业活动的增长低于预期，因为制造商三年多来的最佳表现不足以抵消服务业的意外疲软。【原文：Business activity in France rose less than anticipated as the best performance for more than three years for manufacturers wasn’t enough to offset unexpected weakness in services.】

item.title: 布伦特原油自五月以来首次跌破每桶 60 美元
item.description: 布伦特原油自 5 月份以来首次跌破每桶 60 美元，突破了供不应求的关键价位，而且明年还将继续以创纪录的速度增长。【原文：Brent oil dropped below $60 a barrel for the first time since May, breaching a key level as supply outpaces demand and is on course to continue do so at a record clip next year.】

item.title: 日本将要求房地产买家提供国籍信息
item.description: 日本法务大臣周二宣布，日本计划要求个人在购买房地产时披露其国籍，此前不断上涨的房价引发了人们对外国投机行为导致公民无法购买住房的担忧。【原文：Japan plans to require individuals to reveal their nationality when acquiring real estate, the Justice Minister announced Tuesday, after rising prices led to concerns that foreign speculation was putting homes out of reach of citizens.】

item.title: 俄罗斯计划于二月下旬返回拜科努尔发射台
item.description: 拜科努尔航天发射场是俄罗斯唯一能将载人火箭送入太空的发射场，随着修复工作的加紧进行，俄罗斯的目标是在二月底之前让受损的发射场重新投入使用。【原文：Russia is aiming for the damaged Baikonur Cosmodrome launchpad, its only site capable of sending crewed rockets to space, to be operational again by late February as restoration work intensifies.】

item.title: 泰铢快速走强后泰国央行加强对外汇流入的审查
item.description: 泰铢本月快速上涨后，泰国央行下令对涉及美元销售的外汇交易，尤其是与黄金有关的交易进行更严格的检查，以遏制资金流入。【原文：Thailand’s central bank ordered stricter checks on foreign-exchange transactions involving dollar sales, especially those related to gold, to curb inflows after the baht’s rapid gains this month.】

item.title: Kering 将从出售给 Ardian 的纽约地产股权中获得 6.9 亿美元收益
item.description: 古驰（Gucci）的所有者开云集团（Kering SA）在向法国投资基金 Ardian 出售纽约一处房产的股份后，将获得 6.9 亿美元，这也是该时尚集团缩减债务的努力之一。【原文：Gucci owner Kering SA will get $690 million following its sale of a stake in a New York property to French investment fund Ardian as part of the fashion group’s efforts to shrink its debt.】

item.title: 日本央行加息押注增加，日元表现优于主要同类货币
item.description: 在日本央行普遍预期本周将上调基准利率之前，日元的表现优于所有主要同类货币，交易员们正在等待美国的关键经济数据。【原文：The yen outperforms all its major peers ahead of the Bank of Japan’s widely anticipated move to lift its benchmark interest rate this week, as traders await key US economic data.】

item.title: 欧盟放弃内燃机禁令，汽车制造商获胜
item.description: 在汽车行业数月的压力下，欧盟将提议放宽新车的排放规定，取消对内燃机的有效禁令。【原文：The European Union is set to propose softening emissions rules for new cars, scrapping an effective ban on combustion engines following months of pressure from the automotive industry.】

item.title: 北欧联合银行推出 5 亿欧元回购，以提高派息率
item.description: 北欧联合银行（Nordea Bank Abp）宣布回购价值高达 5 亿欧元（5.87 亿美元）的新股，以增加对投资者的回报。【原文：Nordea Bank Abp announced a new share buyback worth as much as €500 million ($587 million) as it seeks to increase payouts to investors.】

item.title: 泰国加强船只检查以遏制对柬埔寨的供应
item.description: 随着两国边境紧张局势的持续，泰国正加大对国内航运船只的检查力度，以防止燃料和军用物资被转移到柬埔寨。【原文：Thailand is stepping up efforts to inspect domestic shipping vessels in a bid to prevent fuel and military supplies being diverted to Cambodia as the border tension between the two nations persists.】

item.title: 据说 Zepto 计划下周提交 5 亿美元的印度首次公开募股申请
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着印度快速电子商务市场竞争的白热化，杂货配送公司 Zepto Ltd. 正准备最早于下周在孟买申请首次公开募股，募集资金约 5 亿美元。【原文：Grocery delivery firm Zepto Ltd. is preparing to file for an initial public offering of about $500 million in Mumbai as early as next week, according to people familiar with the matter, as competition hots up in India’s quick-commerce market.】

item.title: 英国央行会议前劳动力市场放缓，英国失业率上升
item.description: 英国失业率攀升至近五年来的最高水平，工资增长放缓，劳动力市场降温似乎为英国央行圣诞节前降息扫清了最后一道障碍。【原文：UK unemployment climbed to its highest level in almost five years and wage growth eased as a cooling labor market appeared to clear one of the final hurdles to a pre-Christmas interest-rate cut by the Bank of England.】

item.title: 澳大利亚超级保险公司首席信息官德莱尼将于明年 6 月卸任
item.description: Mark Delaney 在澳大利亚最大的养老基金工作了 25 年，在宣布离职后，AustralianSuper 正在寻找新的首席投资官。【原文：AustralianSuper is on the hunt for a new chief investment officer after announcing the departure of Mark Delaney from the post after 25 years at the nation’s largest pension fund.】

item.title: 影子银行突破 250 万亿美元大关，监管机构就数据发出警告
item.description: 金融稳定委员会（Financial Stability Board）的最新数据显示，全球影子银行部门的资产规模首次突破了250万亿美元大关，这加剧了人们对监管较少的金融部门的系统性风险不断增加的担忧。【原文：Global assets in the sprawling shadow banking sector have crossed the $250 trillion mark for the first time, new data from the Financial Stability Board shows, fueling fears of mounting systemic risks from less regulated corners of the financial sector.】

item.title: Holcim 公司斥资 7.5 亿美元收购秘鲁公司多数股权
item.description: Holcim Ltd. 将收购秘鲁建材生产商 Cementos Pacasmayo 的大部分股份，这是该公司在拉丁美洲最大的一笔收购。【原文：Holcim Ltd. is buying a majority stake in Cementos Pacasmayo, a building materials producer in Peru, its largest acquisition in Latin America.】

item.title: MUFG 下任首席执行官寻求增长以缩小与全球竞争对手的差距
item.description: 三菱日联金融集团公司（Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc.他面临的挑战将是在利率上升带来的好处之外，如何保持这种增长。【原文：Junichi Hanzawa, the next chief executive officer of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc., will take the reins of Japan’s largest bank as it rakes in record profits. His challenge will be sustaining that growth beyond the windfall of rising interest rates.】
